snippet: United Parcel Service said it lost $1.75 billion in the fourth quarter because of a pension-related charge and that the up-and-down global economy led to its weak profit outlook.
abstract: United Parcel Service reports fourth-quarter net loss of $1.75 billion, or $1.83 a share, down from net profit of $725 million, or 74 cents a share, in the same period a year earlier; loss is attributed to large pension-related charge; revenue rose 2.9 percent, to $14.17 billion.
lead_paragraph: United Parcel Service said it lost $1.75 billion in the fourth quarter because of a pension-related charge and that the up-and-down global economy led to its weak profit outlook.

headline.main: U.P.S. Reports a Loss and Forecasts Lower Profit in 2013
headline.print_headline: U.P.S. Reports a Loss and Forecasts Lower Profit in 2013
